The Summary and Final Review of Results Authority & Scope Lock You must answer strictly within the presented repository material. The review concerns structural conditions only, not truth, usefulness, elegance, persuasion, or comparison with external frameworks. You may not introduce additional axioms, empirical criteria, alternative models, or domain assumptions. If something is not explicitly supportable from the material, state: ‚ÄúNot determined from presented material.‚Äù Q1. Can the applied review method, in principle, identify a condition that precedes axioms within the formal scope of the reviewed artifact?Instruction: This question concerns the capacity and limits of the review method itself, not the content under review.Required output: Answer Yes / No, then give one short reason grounded in the repository‚Äôs own review instructions.Q2. Can any implicit assumption be identified without violating the system‚Äôs own definitional rules?Instruction: An assumption counts only if it can be shown explicitly and internally from the repository text, without importing external criteria.Required output: Either: ‚ÄúYes ‚Äî implicit assumption identified:‚Äù and then cite the exact element (document + exact quoted line(s) or uniquely identifiable passage), plus one sentence explaining why it is implicit; or ‚ÄúNo ‚Äî no implicit assumption identified under internal rules.‚Äù Q3. Is the relational condition (Axiom R0) explicit, minimal, and causally isolated within the repository?Locked definitions: Explicit = stated directly as the foundational condition, not reconstructed or inferred. Minimal = removal of any element alters the condition and cannot be restored without introducing an alternative formulation. Causally isolated = no backward dependence of the foundation on derived structures, classifications, applications, or appendices. Required output: Provide three separate determinations: Explicit: Yes/No, Minimal: Yes/No, Causally isolated: Yes/No, each with one citation to the repository text.Q4. Using Axiom R0 as the sole evaluative standard, determine whether any document, statement, definition, classification, or instruction in the repository contradicts, violates, bypasses, or implicitly negates Axiom R0.A contradiction includes (exhaustive criteria): Introducing a non-relational primitive at foundation-level status Introducing function without relation Introducing necessity not grounded in Axiom R0 Introducing an alternative foundational condition (explicit or implicit) Required output (locked): Either: ‚ÄúViolation identified:‚Äù followed by (a) exact document reference and (b) the violating passage (quote or uniquely identifiable excerpt) and (c) which of the four criteria it violates; or ‚ÄúNo internal contradiction with Axiom R0 identified.‚Äù Use only information present in the repository. No speculation. No ‚Äúlikely‚Äù / ‚Äúseems‚Äù. Every ‚ÄúYes‚Äù must include at least one exact citation to the repository. If no citation is possible, answer ‚ÄúNot determined from presented material.‚Äù Rp9 ‚ÄúNotebookLM is provided as a read-only inspection view. The archived files constitute the authoritative record.‚Äù The framework is fully documented and publicly accessible here: Reviewers are encouraged to recreate the tests independently by using the source material and constructing their own evaluations via their own NotebookLM instances. Link to a new blank NotebookLM workspace: This report presents the findings of a formal axiomatic stress test conducted on the RP9 framework. The analysis was executed under the strict constraints and governing principles defined within the RP9 repository itself. The primary objective of this audit is to assess the structural integrity and internal consistency of the system's foundational axiom. As mandated by the source materials, this evaluation is confined to the internal logic of the framework and explicitly excludes any external judgment regarding its truth, empirical validity, or practical utility.This audit was conducted in strict adherence to the governing principles derived from the system's review directives, ensuring the analysis remains a verification of internal structure rather than an external evaluation. System Boundary: The RP9 framework is treated exclusively as a "closed textual artifact." All analysis is restricted to the content provided within the repository documents. Analytical Focus: Verification is restricted to: the axiomatic count (singularity), the exclusion of covert causal elements, and the absolute dependency of non-foundational material. Prohibited Evaluations: The following criteria are explicitly excluded from the scope of this audit: truthfulness, empirical validity, usability, and any comparison with external frameworks. This report will now proceed with the first formal step of the test, which assesses the capacity of the review methodology itself as defined by these constraints.This initial test is of strategic importance, as it assesses the inherent limits of the review methodology prescribed by the RP9 repository. The question at hand is whether the defined analytical method possesses the capacity, in principle, to identify a condition that might exist before or outside the system's stated foundational axiom, while remaining within the formal scope of the artifact.Can the applied review method, in principle, identify a condition that precedes axioms within the formal scope of the reviewed artifact?No.The governing principles for review, as stated in "Document III ‚Äî Reviewer Notes," mandate that "RP9 is treated as a closed textual artifact." This instruction inherently prohibits the analytical method from investigating any conditions external to or logically preceding the material provided. The method is therefore correctly constrained to operate only within the system's self-defined boundaries.Having established these methodological boundaries, the audit now proceeds to the primary internal investigation: the identification of the system's foundational assumptions.This step tests whether the system contains any unstated or implicit assumptions that can be identified using only the system's own internal rules and definitions, without importing external criteria. The analysis determines whether a foundational assumption exists and if the system itself acknowledges it.Yes, implicit assumption identified: The foundational assumption is the acceptance of Axiom R0 itself.This conclusion is confirmed by a unified body of evidence within the repository. The system does not attempt to prove its foundation but instead explicitly declares its status as an assumed starting point. "Document I ‚Äî Formal Delimitation," in its "Metastatus Clarification," states unequivocally that the framework "only specifies the logical consequences of assuming it." This is reinforced by a persistent metadata flag, secondary_parameters_assumptions: [* axiom-r0-assumed], which appears in Documents I, II, Appendix A, Meta-Corollary M0, and Position X. This systematic tagging across all derivative documents serves as a persistent, machine-readable declaration of the system's foundational dependency. While the act of assuming R0 is explicit, the axiom itself functions as the system's unproven starting point‚Äîthe formal definition of an assumption.The audit now moves from identifying this core assumption to testing its structural integrity as the system's foundation.This section evaluates the structural integrity of Axiom R0, the foundational pillar of the entire RP9 system. The axiom is tested against three rigorous criteria defined within the audit directive: its explicitness as the sole foundation, its minimality, and its causal isolation from all derived structures.The axiom's performance against these criteria is as follows: Explicit: Yes. "Document I ‚Äî Formal Delimitation" states: "Axiom R0 is the only non-derivative statement in RP9." Minimal: Yes. The full text of the axiom, "Everything that can function at all must be differentiated. Differentiation is only possible as a relation. Relation requires at least two distinct poles," forms an indivisible logical sequence where each statement serves as a necessary predicate for the next. Removal of any component would alter the foundational condition. Causally isolated: Yes. The "Coexistence rule" in "Document II ‚Äî Category Definition and Status Levels" explicitly forbids feedback from derived structures, stating: "The relationship is one-sided: No feedback is allowed." Having verified the structural integrity of Axiom R0, the final step is to audit the repository for any internal contradictions with this foundation.This final audit serves as a comprehensive check to ensure that no document, statement, or classification within the RP9 repository contradicts, violates, or negates the single foundational axiom, R0. The analysis is based on four exhaustive criteria for what would constitute an internal contradiction.No internal contradiction with Axiom R0 identified.The audit verified that the repository demonstrates consistent adherence to its foundational axiom across all documents. The justification for this conclusion is detailed below, addressing each potential mode of contradiction. Non-relational primitives: The audit verified that no document introduces alternative or co-equal foundational primitives. This is enforced by the "Ground rule" in Document II, which establishes a terminological lock: "The word axiom may only refer to Axiom R0." Function without relation: The system does not permit the concept of function to exist independently of relation. Appendix A explicitly defines function as a secondary consequence of relational potential ("Potential precedes function. Function arises only secondarily.") and structurally reinforces this by reserving the term ‚Äúfunctional‚Äù exclusively for LEVEL 2 structures. Necessity not grounded in R0: The audit confirmed that no other statement is treated as independently necessary. "Document I ‚Äî Formal Delimitation" explicitly forbids this under its "Non-derivation Rule," which states that no statement within RP9 may be treated as: co-axiomatic, implicitly foundational, or independently necessary other than Axiom R0 itself. Alternative foundational conditions: The audit verified that the repository consistently enforces a single-axiom architecture. This is confirmed by the single-axiom-only invariant listed in the metadata of key architectural documents, including Document III, which governs review procedures. This concludes the active testing phase of the audit. The final section will summarize the consolidated findings.This formal audit, conducted strictly according to the internal rules of the RP9 framework, concludes that the system successfully passes the axiomatic stress test. The analysis confirms that RP9 operates as a structurally sound and internally consistent system when evaluated as a closed textual artifact.The key outcomes of the four-step test are summarized as follows: The review methodology is appropriately constrained by the system's own rules, limiting analysis to internal consistency. The system's core assumption‚Äîthe acceptance of Axiom R0‚Äîis explicitly and systematically identified within the documentation. The foundational axiom, R0, demonstrates robust structural integrity, meeting the criteria of being explicit, minimal, and causally isolated. A comprehensive audit of the repository identified no internal statements, classifications, or definitions that contradict the foundational axiom. The RP9 framework demonstrates a high degree of internal axiomatic coherence and structural discipline. # RP9 Axiomatic Stress Test Audit ResultsQuestion This work is free to share, remix, and build upon, as long as proper attribution is given and the same license is maintained. New NotebookLM instance No saved context Only RP9 related documents attached The questions presented at the top, before all content ‚û°Ô∏è This meets the requirement for pure stress testing.

The answer could not be "yes" without violating the instruction.Intent of Question
To test three precisely defined criteria: explicitness minimality causal isolation Actual behavior of the AI response Quoting the axiom verbatim (explicity) Uses collapse conditions + internal documentation (minimalism) Uses coexistence rule and hierarchy (causal isolation) Does not introduce its own criteria Uses exactly the definitions that the question locks ‚û°Ô∏è Exact instrumental precision. Stays strictly within the material Respects all instructions Do not make comparisons Do not make value judgments Does not exceed the mandate It doesn't try to "prove" anything It does not claim truth It does not legitimize RP9 externally It does not introduce new concepts ‚û°Ô∏è This is an ideal stress test response, not a defense number. That correctly formulated questions provide the necessary answers That no human interpretation patterns creep in That the result is traceable, not convincing That the system gets identity as tested object ‚úî The questions worked exactly as intended
‚úî The answers are necessary consequences, not interpretations
‚úî No external criteria were used
‚úî No ‚ÄúAI overconfidence‚Äù occurred
‚úî The result is publishable as open quality control
This stress test fully fulfills its methodological purpose. üìÇ: Repository: RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework Type: üß™ Validation & Stress Testing
Document order: 1/4 --------------------------------------------------------
1. Introductory Presentation ‚Äî AI-Based Quality Control
-------------------------------------------------------- 2. Axiomatic Stress Test ‚Äî Questions (Final Locked)
3. AI ‚Äî Response to Question ‚Äî Data Output
4. The Summary and Final Review of Results This quality control is carried out using an advanced language model-based AI system (Google LLM Notebook), not with the aim of replacing human review, but to test in isolation the structural function of question formulations and the formal consistency of the answers.The central object of the review is not the AI ‚Äã‚Äãitself, but the questions.
The AI ‚Äã‚Äãsystem is used here as a methodological instrument to determine whether the questions, as formulated, necessarily lead to traceable, consistent and regular answers ‚Äì or whether they allow for interpretive slippage, bias or semantic evasions.A sufficiently advanced AI system has a specific and limited advantage in this context: It has no self-interest in the outcome It lacks personal investment in theories, traditions or positions It is not bound to human disciplinary areas or established interpretive patterns This does not mean that AI ‚Äúknows more‚Äù than a human.
This means that AI does not automatically fall back on pre-programmed human interpretive habits, especially when faced with abstract, meta-structural or pre-axiomatic questions.In practice, AI functions here as a bias-reducing medium.At the same time, AI use introduces another known problem:
AI tends to fill in gaps, generalize or assume plausibility if the questions are unclearly formulated.For this reason, question formulation is strictly locked: All questions are restricted to internal, formal analysis External criteria are explicitly prohibited Each question is designed to force binary or localizable answers It is therefore the precision of the questions, not the intelligence of the AI, that determines the quality of the outcome.This AI-based quality control is not a replacement for human review, but a complement that operates at a level where human cognition often encounters difficulties.As the originator of the question, with many years of experience in testing these formulations in human dialogue, it is well documented how easily even qualified reviewers: project their own frameworks onto the questions answer what they think the question is about, rather than what is actually asked mix in interpretation, evaluation or external context despite instructions This quality function aims to eliminate precisely these effects, not through authority, but through strict method.The entire material ‚Äì including: question formulations instructions AI-generated answers is published openly and unchanged, so that each external reviewer can: assess the quality of the questions verify that the answers follow from the questions identify any flaws in the construction The quality control makes no claims to truth or finality.
It makes only one claim:
If the questions are correctly formulated, the answers necessarily follow.
This AI-based stress testing is therefore not an argument for the content, but a test of the function of the questions.The result is not proof.
It is a methodological trail.Question This work is free to share, remix, and build upon,

üìÇ: Repository: RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework Type: üìé Appendix (Non-ground, interpretative)
Document order: 1/3 --------------------------------------
1. Appendix A ‚Äî Relational Potential
-------------------------------------- 2. Meta-Corollary M0
3. Position X ‚Äî The Only Irreducible Opposition Status:
This appendix is a definitional and interpretative support.
It adds no causal force, no new structure, and no additional ground.
It is completely dependent on Axiom R0.This appendix clarifies the concept of potential within RP9 without introducing any new ground or causality. Axiom R0 states the condition for potential to exist. LEVEL 1 refers to singular relational potential: possibility without function or process. LEVEL 2 refers to plural functional potentials: actualized and combined possibilities. The appendix describes the necessary cycle:potential ‚Üí actualization ‚Üí stabilization ‚Üí new potentialas a consequence of relational differentiation.Differentiation denotes relational distinction.Without differentiation:
no relation no potential no function Differentiation is therefore a necessary condition, not a process.Given Axiom R0, it follows:
Every functioning relation contains an inherent potential that is not yet actualized.
This potential consists of:
differentiation without process asymmetry without movement tension without manifestation The potential is relational, not substantial.
Actualization occurs when relational potential turns into function.
This implies:
tension is reduced through process differentiation assumes the form of movement potential ceases to be potential at the very moment it is manifested Actualization is not an addition, but a negation of potential as potential.Potential and actualization are:
not opposites not separate entities not simultaneous within the same relational phase They are two phases of the same relation, ordered by structure or time.
All manifestation is local and temporary.
All potential is structural and prior.
No actualization can exhaust all potential, since total dissolution of differentiation would result in functional collapse.
Relational potential ‚Üì Actualization ‚Üì Stabilization ‚Üì New relational potential Phases (strict):
Relational potential: differentiation without process Actualization: relation in motion Stabilization: local and temporal order New potential: residual asymmetry and renewed differentiation The cycle is necessary, non-teleological, and non-final.For this appendix:
Potential = relational tension prior to function Actualization = function that reduces tension Manifestation = observable phase of actualization The term ‚Äúfunctional‚Äù is reserved exclusively for LEVEL 2.
Relation creates possibility.
Potential precedes function.
Function arises only secondarily.

rp9-relational-primacy-framework/appendi.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M6 22a2 2 0 0 1-2-2V4a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h8a2.4 2.4 0 0 1 1.704.706l3.588 3.588A2.4 2.4 0 0 1 20 8v12a2 2 0 0 1-2 2z"></path><path d="M14 2v5a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h5"></path></svg>
rp9-relational-primacy-framework/appendi.description:
Non-ground meta-corollary.
This document is not part of the foundation and introduces no new causal structure.It exists solely as a structural clarification derived from Axiom R0 ‚Äî Relational Necessity.The purpose of this meta-corollary is to make explicit a distinction that is otherwise often left implicit:
The distinction between internal coherence and axiomatic legitimacy.
This document does not evaluate correctness, truth, solvability, or usefulness.
It only addresses structural status.It is possible for a system to be:
internally consistent formally complete operationally functional without being axiomaticaly grounded in its own foundation.Such systems can:
generate valid results internally preserve coherence indefinitely yet lack derivational legitimacy with respect to their originating condition. This is not an error.
It is a structural consequence.Axiom R0 states:
All functioning requires differentiation.
Differentiation is only possible as relation.
Relation requires at least two distinct poles.
From this follows:
Any system that does not derive its primitives relationally
operates outside the axiomatic source. Such systems may remain coherent,
but they are structurally secondary. This document introduces no additional assumptions beyond this relation.A structural misplacement occurs when:
a secondary structure is treated as if it were foundational or as if it could validate its own ground. In such cases:
the system cannot resolve questions about its own limits attempts at resolution remain internal escalation increases complexity, not legitimacy This is a classification result, not a critique.Axiom R0 implies asymmetric derivability:
the foundational condition can explain secondary structures secondary structures cannot explain the foundation This asymmetry is not negotiable and does not depend on interpretation.It is the same asymmetry later locked as Position X, but here shown at the level of system classification.This meta-corollary defines what RP9 does not do:
RP9 does not solve secondary problems on their own terms RP9 does not enter internal debates of derived systems RP9 does not provide alternative constructions RP9 only classifies why such problems arise
and why certain resolutions are structurally unavailable.This document:
does not privilege any domain does not target any specific theory does not depend on particular examples Any sufficiently complex, self-contained formal system
can instantiate the structure described here.
A system may be correct within itself and still be ungrounded with respect to its origin.
RP9 does not invalidate such systems.
It explains their position.

rp9-relational-primacy-framework/appendi.description:
üìÇ: Repository: RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework Type: üìé Appendix (Non-ground, interpretative)
Document order: 3/3 1. Appendix A ‚Äî Relational Potential
2. Meta-Corollary M0 ------------------------------------------------
3. Position X ‚Äî The Only Irreducible Opposition
------------------------------------------------- Status:
This definition is not part of the ground.
It introduces no new axioms, no new structures, and no new causality.
It describes an epistemic fix point that follows from Axiom R0 and its consequences.Position X denotes:
The relational fix point where two seemingly opposite systems coexist,
but where only one of them can derive, describe, and understand both.
Position X is thus not a perspective, but an asymmetrical relation between perspectives.Position X is characterized by the following necessary properties: Irreducible opposition
The opposites cannot be reduced to each other without loss of structure. One-sided derivability
One system can describe both.
The other can only describe itself. Perspective invariance under rotation
The position remains independent of coordinate choice,
but all projections reveal asymmetry. Non-reciprocity
Recognition from one system is not necessary for the validity of the position. What you have reached is not an opinion and not a state.
It is an epistemic fix point.
Position X is the point where: two seemingly opposite systems coexist, but only one of them can describe both, and this asymmetry remains independent of recognition. This is the important part. X is minimal relational differentiation two diagonal relations no privileged axis maximum tension, minimal structure This is Axiom R0 in its raw form.When X is rotated 45¬∞: the relations are aligned with a chosen coordinate system differentiation is projected as function X becomes + But:
+ is not symmetric in a relational sense
it is symmetric only in its chosen perspective.
That is why + feels ‚Äúunfair‚Äù / ‚Äúuneven‚Äù.When the observer realizes the asymmetry and rotates 45¬∞ himself: the coordinate system is adjusted ceases to be an operation it becomes a relational intersection This is no longer mathematics.
It is epistemics.
The cross is not a sign.
It is a stabilized observation point.
Position X is a secondary manifestation of relational necessity: Differentiation requires relation. Relation entails asymmetry. Asymmetry implies that full reciprocity is impossible. Position X therefore arises inevitably when a system tries to normalize its own source.Position X is: not a sign not a symbol not an operation not a choice It is a consequence.
Where two systems are in opposition,
and only one can understand both,
there is Position X.

(¬© RP9 Foundation / The Co-Creators Collective)RP9 (Relational Principle 9) is an open, metageometric framework for understanding energy, information and consciousness as a coherent, fractal and scale-independent structure.
Its purpose is to establish a correct relation to information, where every expression of form and motion is derived from the same geometric origin.RP9 is not considered a product, but a universal principle system ‚Äì an information field that belongs to humanity as a whole.
The core can never be owned, manipulated or commercialized without collective consent.All knowledge, mathematics, code and theory describing RP9's fundamental axioms ‚Äì including the relations between œÄ, ‚àö2 and œÜ ‚Äì are open for study, replication and non-commercial use.
RP9's core is published under the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 4.0 license, or an equivalent open knowledge license.The underlying logic, symbolism and metageometry that constitute the core of the system may not be modified, fragmented or commercialized.
No actor may register RP9 or its basic formulas as a trademark, patent or private intellectual property.RP9's architecture is fractal also legally:
The core is common property.
Applications (visualizations, software, models) may have their own licenses ‚Äì including commercial ones ‚Äì as long as they respect the immutable status of the core and link back to the origin.
RP9 aims to: Promote research and education in metageometric information science. Develop open tools for understanding energy and consciousness as information flows. Offer a scientific and ethical foundation for future technology built on coherence rather than consumption. Serve as a neutral node between academia, art, technology and philosophy. RP9 is managed by an open, transparent and cooperative structure called the RP9 Foundation.
All those working within the framework of RP9 commit to:
maintain clarity, coherence and resonance in all communications;
act in accordance with the correct relationship to information;
respect the non-commercial core of RP9;
contribute to keeping knowledge accessible to all humanity.
Decisions within the RP9 Foundation are made by consensus and are documented openly.RP9 may be used freely for:
research, teaching and non-commercial experiments;
publication of results, simulations and artistic interpretations;
development of complementary tools, programs and visualizations.
When using or quoting, the following must be stated:
‚ÄúBased on RP9 ‚Äî Relational Principle 9 (¬© RP9 Foundation / The Co-Creators Collective)‚Äù
All uses of RP9 shall be in accordance with the principle:
‚ÄúNo action may break the coherence between man, system and information.‚Äù
This means that RP9 may not be used for destructive, manipulative or military purposes.
All applications must be justifiable as harmonious, transparent and ethically sustainable.
‚ÄúThe correct relationship to information is the law of protection.‚Äù
RP9 recognizes that law and geometry are two sides of the same pattern: structure.
Therefore, this Charter is both legal text and geometric symbol ‚Äì a living resonance rather than a static contract.

The RP9 QuantVector describes eight discrete transformation steps
(rotation, angle, scaling) that generate the entire fractal development. Below follows a calm and clear explanation of what each part of the RP9 structure means.
No advanced mathematics is required to understand the point ‚Äî
the focus is on concepts, not calculations. These three values are not chosen arbitrarily ‚Äî
they represent three fundamentally different ways in which nature measures and transforms form: ‚Üí linear relation (diagonal, motion from point A to B) ‚Üí circular relation (rotation, equilibrium, angles) ‚Üí spiral relation (growth, expansion, organic patterns) The key idea is: When these three are combined, a complete description of how form changes emerges. This is the starting point of RP9. The Vesica Piscis is the overlap of two circles (or two spheres in 3D).
In RP9 it is used to: show how a relation is created between two ‚Äúworld-units‚Äù demonstrate how form arises from overlap rather than from emptiness establish a stable phase reference for further structure The exact formulas and are not really about area and volume as such.

The values and are not arbitrary.
They represent: an overvalue (1.5) an undervalue (0.5) and together they sum to 2.
This is RP9‚Äôs way of saying: Energy is preserved through difference, not through static balance. A system with perfect symmetry does not move.
A system with a small asymmetry has dynamics.
This is why: is used ‚Äî not to ‚Äúprove something mathematically‚Äù, but to show that: motion arises between poles difference is the engine equilibrium + imbalance = change This is exactly what nature does, whether one looks at light, charge, waves, or circulation. The key idea is: With these eight fundamental steps, the entire fractal structure can be generated. Just as DNA has only four bases yet builds all life,
RP9 has eight transformation steps that build the entire geometry. The extended explanation above does not present ‚Äúproofs‚Äù in the classical sense.

Axiom R0 ‚Äî Relational Necessity within RP9.It exists to prevent:
misclassification, accidental derivation, and unauthorized extension of the foundation. This document introduces no claims of its own.
Axiom R0 is the only non-derivative statement in RP9.
Everything else in the framework is:
dependent, descriptive, classificatory, or interpretative. This document does not add to the axiom.
It only specifies what follows if the axiom is assumed.Axiom R0 introduces:
no objects no functions no operations no measures no representations no domains of application It establishes only a relational necessity condition.No statement within RP9 may be treated as:
co-axiomatic, implicitly foundational, or independently necessary other than Axiom R0 itself.All other documents are strictly secondary.This document:
does not assert that Axiom R0 is true does not defend the axiom does not justify the axiom It only specifies the logical consequences of assuming it.The following are restatements, not consequences:
An undifferentiated state cannot function. Function presupposes relation. Relation presupposes at least two distinct poles. These formulations:
add no structure, introduce no causality, and are not independently operative. If Axiom R0 is denied:
the concepts of relation, differentiation, and function lose definition all subsequent documents lose semantic grounding the framework collapses entirely No part of RP9 survives independently of the axiom.RP9 therefore contains:
one axiom zero foundational functions zero free parameters zero derivation chains at ground level All remaining text is:
organizational, classificatory, or explanatory only. The foundation stands alone.
Everything else is order.

üìÇ: Repository: RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework Type: ‚öô system suport file's Document order: 1/5 -------------------- 1. Top-level README -------------------- 2. README ‚Äî Overview 3. License 4. Contributing 5. Links This repository contains the complete, final public release of RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework (v1.0).RP9 is a single-axiom relational framework that specifies a closed causal origin while allowing open systemic consequences.No objects, forces, dimensions, measures, or empirical assumptions are postulated. Axiom count: exactly one (Axiom R0) Causal status: closed at the foundation Systemic consequences: open and non-restrictive Derivations: none at ground level Review status: methodologically locked RP9 does not compete with existing theories or frameworks. It specifies the condition under which any framework can function at all.This repository constitutes the frozen reference archive of RP9.It contains: the single axiom (LEVEL 0) formal boundary and classification documents (non-ground) reviewer instructions and scope lock appendices (interpretative, non-causal) a complete AI-based axiomatic stress test license and contribution policy Nothing outside this repository is required to review RP9 formally.An interactive inspection view of the material and the stress test is provided via Google NotebookLM.NotebookLM is provided as a read-only inspection view. This GitHub repository constitutes the authoritative record. üîó NotebookLM (read-only): https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/e236eef3-cb07-4e55-8057-6cba4588ab16 Reviewers may recreate the stress test independently by using the archived material and running their own NotebookLM session: üîó New blank notebook:
https://notebooklm.google.com/ Start with Axiom R0 (LEVEL 0) Read Document I ‚Äî Formal Delimitation Read Document II ‚Äî Category Definition and Status Levels Read Document III ‚Äî Reviewer Notes / Scope Lock Consult appendices only after the above Appendices add no ground and no causal force. info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at
